column4: Hi All, I just installed ubuntu and I'm booting to the drive that I know I installed to but when I reboot after installation it does not load up into Unbuntu?  It's almost like it never installs grub even though I tell it too.
so I have a swap and ext partition
I do have a drive in the pc with NTFS on it though that I didnt partition
at the very basic level, you should have a root partition (/), swap partition, and a home partition
ext is a file system, btw - kinda like NTFS on Windows
understood, just not understand why I can boot to the drive I installed ubuntu on
Am I correct that you are dual booting with Windows then?
your are not, I just have files on my second hard drive from a windows computer that I would like to have on my ubuntu machine
And you are certain that BRUB installed to the MBR?
It asked me if I wanted to installed Grub and I of course said yes
That will walk you through reinstalling GRUB from the Live CD
also what is the fastest/best file system to use
Everyone has there preferences - I generally run XFS
it is worth noting that FXS is a 64bit file system
